title: Letters from Thomas Percy, D.D. :
snippet: Old people at Newburgh,  from the tradition of their fathers, say, that it was dedicated to a great saint named Magrin, and the lands of Mugdrum, where it stands, were dedicated to his church ; and they shew a cairn three miles east from the cross on an eminence, on which is an obelisk of rough stones or nodules, which is called Magrin's Seat.
